org.sakaiproject.email.api

Class EmailMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.email.api.EmailMessage

  • public class EmailMessage
extends Object
    Value object for sending emails. Mimics javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage without having a dependency on javax.mail

    Sending a message can be done by specifying recipients and/or actual recipients. If only recipients (to, cc, bcc) are specified, those are the people that will recieve the message and will see each other listed in the to, cc and bcc fields. If actual recipients are specified, any other recipients will be ignored but will be added to the email headers appropriately. This allows for mailing to lists and hiding recipients (recipients: mylist@somedomain.edu, actualRecipients: [long list of students].

    The default content type for a message is ContentType.TEXT_PLAIN. The content type only applies to the message body.

    The default character set for a message is UTF-8.

    See Also:
    Transport.send(Message), Transport.send(Message, Address[]), InternetAddress

      • extractHeaders

        public List<String> extractHeaders()
        Flattens the headers down to "key: value" strings.
        Returns:
        List of properly formatted headers. List will be 0 length if no headers found. Does not return null

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(String key)
        Remove a header from this message. Does nothing if header is not found.
        Parameters:
        key -

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String key,
             String value)
        Add a header to this message. If the key is found in the headers of this message, the value is appended to the previous value found and separated by a space. A key of null will not be added. If value is null, previous entries of the matching key will be removed.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the header.
        value - The value of the header.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(String key,
             String value)
        Sets a header to this message. Any previous value for this key will be replaced. If value is null, previous entries of the matching key will be removed.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the header.
        value - The value of the header.

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(Map<String,String> headers)
        Set the headers of this message. Will replace any existing headers.
        Parameters:
        headers - The headers to use on this message.

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(List<String> headers)
        Sets headers on this message. The expected format of each header is key: value.
        Parameters:
        headers -
